title: The Smoke That Thunders - Worlds LARGEST Waterfall
description: Victoria Falls was filmed with the DJI Spark & controller:   Victoria Falls is the worlds largest waterfall. Twice as tall as Niagara Falls, and over 1708 meters wide, and 108 meters tall. (For my USA peopel: thats 5604 feet wide, and 354 feet tall.)   Originally called Mosi-oa-Tunya, meaning The Smoke That Thunders.  The name was changed when explorer David Livingstone decided to call it Victoria falls, after the queen of Britain.   There are two pools where you can sit along the edge of the waterfall. Devils Pool, and Angels pool. In this video you see me and my friends swimming in Angels pool.   Here are my other Drone History videos! transcript: Victoria Falls has been described as one of the seven most beautiful natural wonders in the world. Nestled between the borders of Zambia and Zimbabwe, Victoria Falls is twice as tall as Niagara Falls in the USA and is the largest sheet of falling water on earth. The water you see now is during dry season. Imagine the curtain of water after it starts raining. I'm currently flying my DJI Spark while standing in Angel's Pool. It's similar to Devil's Pool and is the safest of the unsafe places to go for a swim before the water falls 350 feet into the Zambezi River below. [Music] Dr. David Livingston was the first European person to set eyes on this world wonder. He was led there by the natives in a wooden canoe. The natives called the Falls The Smoke that Thunders. And then in typical white explorer fashion, David immediately took it upon himself to boringly rename the Falls after Queen Victoria. Personally, I think The Smoke that Thunders is much more accurate. Dr. Livingston's attempt to have royal brownie points didn't work out too well though since Queen Victoria never actually came to visit the Falls. Her daughter, Princess Victoria, did visit though in 1904, about 60 years later. None of them had the aerial view that you currently have on your screen right now though. Technology is amazing. [Music] This is the fourth video in my drone history series. I'll have the other three videos linked in the video description. Would you ever hike to the edge of these Falls? Let me know in the comments. This whole video was shot with the DJI Spark and controller. I'll add that link in the description as well. And hit that subscribe button if you want to see more videos like this in the future. Thanks a ton for watching and I'll see you around.
